ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He thinks his wealth will make him live for ever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Does he think his wealth will abide for ever with him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He thinks that his wealth will immortalise him forever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: thinking that his property will make him live forever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Does he think that his wealth will prolong his stay on earth forever?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He thinks that his wealth will make him last forever!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: thinking his riches have made him immortal!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He thinketh that his wealth will render him immortal.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: thinking that his wealth will make him live forever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He bethinketh that his wealth shall abide for him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He supposes his wealth will make him immortal!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Thinking that his wealth would make him last for ever!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He thinks that his wealth will make him last forever!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: thinking his wealth will render him immortal!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Thinking that his wealth has made him immortal.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [104:3] He thinks, in his ignorance, that his wealth will make him immortal, never to die.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He) the disbeliever (thinketh that his wealth will render him immortal) in the life of the world.
